text: The Chengdu Open is a men's ATP World Tour 250 series tournament played on outdoor hard courts. It is a new tournament added to the 2016 ATP World Tour and replaces the ATP Malaysian Open event held in Kuala Lumpur. It takes place at the Sichuan International Tennis Center in Chengdu, China. ==Results== ===Singles=== {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !Year !width="200"|Champion !width="200"|Runner-up !width="140"|Score |- |2016 || Karen Khachanov || Albert Ramos-Viñolas || 6–7(4–7), 7–6(7–3), 6–3 |- |2017 || Denis Istomin || Marcos Baghdatis || 3–2 ret. |- |2018 || Bernard Tomic || Fabio Fognini || 6–1, 3–6, 7–6(9–7) |- |2019 || Pablo Carreño Busta || Alexander Bublik || 6–7(5–7), 6–4, 7–6(7–3) |} ===Doubles=== {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !Year !width="200"|Champion !width="200"|Runner-up !width="140"|Score |- |2016 || Raven Klaasen Rajeev Ram || Pablo Carreño Busta Mariusz Fyrstenberg || 7–6(7–2), 7–5 |- |2017 || Jonathan Erlich Aisam-ul-Haq Qureshi || Marcus Daniell Marcelo Demoliner || 6–3, 7–6(7–3) |- |2018 || Ivan Dodig Mate Pavić || Austin Krajicek Jeevan Nedunchezhiyan || 6–2, 6–4 |- |2019 || Nikola Čačić Dušan Lajović || Jonathan Erlich Fabrice Martin || 7–6(11–9), 3–6, [10–3] |} ==References== Category:Tennis tournaments in China Category:Hard court tennis tournaments Category:Sport in Chengdu Category:2016 establishments in China Category:Recurring sporting events established in 2016
